page.title: 03FARMIMG IN ALL STRETTON
page.content: There are{nine farms}in our block. Most of the land is good. The Western side is shale and the Eastern side across the by-pass is boulder clay. Very few fields are ploughed and most land is{grassland}used for grazing or for hay. The higher land is rough pasture with common grazing on the Long Mynd. Some land is marshy. Most of the farms in the valley are dairy farms and some also keep sheep. Only two farms grow some corn. {Old Hall farm is the oldest farm in {the village.}It is a black and white timbered house built about the beginning of the{sixteenth century.} Old Hall Farm is 120 acres which is about average for the area. The farmer has 45 dairy cows but no sheep or chickens. He has some farm machinery but employs a contractor for hay harvest.
